THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)
Chapter 91 – The Reconciliation between the people

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على الشهر بسنديه - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (144/ 9)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ أَبِي طَلْحَةَ عَنْ حَبِيبٍ الْأَحْوَلِ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ صَدَقَةٌ يُحِبُّهَا اللَّهُ إِصْلَاحُ بَيْنِ النَّاسِ إِذَا تَفَاسَدُوا وَ تَقَارُبُ بَيْنِهِمْ إِذَا تَبَاعَدُوا .
عَنْهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حُذَيْفَةَ بْنِ مَنْصُورٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Hammad Bin Abu Talha, from Habeeb Al Ahowl who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> saying: ‘A charity which Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Loves is reconciling between the people when their (relationship) is spoilt, and bringing them close when they are distant’.
From him, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Huzeyfa Bin Mansour, from Abu Abdullahasws – similar to it.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Hammad ibn abu Talhah from Habib al-Ahwal who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘The charity that Allah loves is to improve good relations among the people when they cause devastation, and closeness when they get far away from each other.’” It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Hudhayfah ibn Mansur from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) a similar Hadith.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/145)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَأَنْ أُصْلِحَ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِنْ أَنْ أَتَصَدَّقَ بِدِينَارَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Mahboub, from Hisham Bin Salim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘If I<sup>asws</sup> were to reconcile between two, it would be more beloved to me<sup>asws</sup> than if I were to give charity with two Dinars’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ibn Mahbub from Hisham ibn Salim from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “To improve good relations beween two people is more beloved to me than giving two Dinar in charity.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/145)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ مُفَضَّلٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا رَأَيْتَ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ مِنْ شِيعَتِنَا مُنَازَعَةً فَافْتَدِهَا مِنْ مَالِي .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Sinan, from Mufazzal who said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When you see a dispute between two from our<sup>asws</sup> Shia, so redeem it from my<sup>asws</sup> wealth’.
en.sarwar: 3. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Sinan from Mufaddal who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘When you find two of our followers disputing, settle it between them by means of paying from my property.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/145)

narrator_chain.text: ابْنُ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَنِيفَةَ سَابِقِ الْحَاجِّ قَالَ

text: مَرَّ بِنَا الْمُفَضَّلُ وَ أَنَا وَ خَتَنِي نَتَشَاجَرُ فِي مِيرَاثٍ فَوَقَفَ عَلَيْنَا سَاعَةً ثُمَّ قَالَ لَنَا تَعَالَوْا إِلَى الْمَنْزِلِ فَأَتَيْنَاهُ فَأَصْلَحَ بَيْنَنَا بِأَرْبَعِمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ فَدَفَعَهَا إِلَيْنَا مِنْ عِنْدِهِ حَتَّى إِذَا اسْتَوْثَقَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا مِنْ صَاحِبِهِ قَالَ أَمَا إِنَّهَا لَيْسَتْ مِنْ مَالِي وَ لَكِنْ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَمَرَنِي إِذَا تَنَازَعَ رَجُلَانِ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا فِي شَيْ‏ءٍ أَنْ أُصْلِحَ بَيْنَهُمَا وَ أَفْتَدِيَهَا مِنْ مَالِهِ فَهَذَا مِنْ مَالِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Ibn Sinan, from Abu Haneefa Sabiq Al Hajj who said,

‘Al-Mufazzal passed by us and I and my brother in law were quarrelling regarding an inheritance. So he paused by us for a while, then said to us, ‘Come, let us go to the house. So we went with him and he reconciled between us with four hundred Dirhams. So he handed it over from himself until each one of us was confident from his companion. He said, ‘But, it is from my wealth, but Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> ordered me that whenever two men from our Shias dispute with regards to anything, that I should reconcile between them and redeem if from his<sup>asws</sup> wealth. Thus, this is from the wealth of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ibn Sinan has narrated from abu Hanifah Sabiq al-Hajj who has said the following: “Al-Mufaddal once passed us nearby, while my daughter in-law and I were disputing about a legacy. He stood by for a while and then said to us, ‘Come to my house.’ We went there and he settled it between us for four hundred dirhams, which he paid from his own pocket until each of us was happy with the other. He then said, ‘It was not from my property. It was from the property of abu ‘Abd Allah, recipient of divine supreme covenant. He had ordered me that whenever two of our people dispute on an issue; I can settle it from his property. Payment was from the property of abu ‘Abd Allah, recipient of divine supreme covenant.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (146/ 9)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The reconciliation is not (supposed to be) with lies’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn Al-Mughirah from Mu’awiyah ibn ‘Ammar from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “A councilor cannot lie (is not supposed to).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/146)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ
لا تَجْعَلُوا اللَّهَ عُرْضَةً لِأَيْمانِكُمْ أَنْ تَبَرُّوا

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لا تَجْعَلُوا اللَّهَ عُرْضَةً لِأَيْمانِكُمْ أَنْ تَبَرُّوا وَ تَتَّقُوا وَ تُصْلِحُوا بَيْنَ النَّاسِ قَالَ

text: إِذَا دُعِيتَ لِصُلْحٍ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ فَلَا تَقُلْ عَلَيَّ يَمِينٌ أَلَّا أَفْعَلَ .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Ali Bin Ismail, from Is’haq Bin Amaar,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding the Words of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic

[2:224] And make not Allah because of your swearing (by Him) an obstacle to your doing good and acting rightly and reconciling between the people. Heasws said: ‘Whenever you are called to effect reconciliation between two, so do not say, ‘Upon me there is an oath. I will not do it’’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Ali ibn Isma’il from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “About the words of Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, ‘Do not swear (saying, ‘By Allah’) I will not do good things, or have piety, or make peace among people. . . .,’ [2:224] the Imam said, “When you are called for arbitration between two people, do not say 1 have sworn not to do it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (148/ 9)

parts.text: مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ أَوْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ أَوْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبْلِغْ عَنِّي كَذَا وَ كَذَا فِي أَشْيَاءَ أَمَرَ بِهَا قُلْتُ فَأُبَلِّغُهُمْ عَنْكَ وَ أَقُولُ عَنِّي مَا قُلْتَ لِي وَ غَيْرَ الَّذِي قُلْتَ قَالَ نَعَمْ إِنَّ الْمُصْلِحَ لَيْسَ بِكَذَّابٍ إِنَّمَا هُوَ الصُّلْحُ لَيْسَ بِكَذِبٍ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ibn Mahboub, from Muawiya Bin Wahab, or Muawiya Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Deliver from me<sup>asws</sup> such and such regarding things I<sup>asws</sup> am ordering with’. I said, ‘So I should deliver them from you<sup>asws</sup>, and can I be saying from me what you<sup>asws</sup> said to me, and other than that which you<sup>asws</sup> said?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes. The reconciler is not a liar. But rather, it is the reconciliation not being with a lie’.
en.sarwar: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from ibn Mahbub from Mu’awiyah ibn Wahab or Mu’awiyah ibn ‘Ammar from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) once said, ‘Convey from me to so and so, in a few matters that he commanded me to do.’ I said, ‘Therefore I convey from you to them and say from myself only what you have told me to say and other things that you said.’ The Imam said, ‘Yes, an arbitrator cannot lie. He is the councilor, not a liar. ’”
